page.title: 14BRICK MAKING
page.content: Bricks are made of shale, fire- clay, dye and water.When the shale is dug up it is put into a machine which gets rid of the unwanted things like sulphur etc. The shale is put onto a pile outside for a month to weather. Then it goes into a big pan and two rollers, ten tons in weight, rotate and crush the shale. Next, water and fireclay are added. This goes into a vacuum chamber where all the air is sucked out and it comes out in a never ending cuboid length. Another machine perforates the cuboid and cuts it into brick size. The bricks go in a drier to harden. There they are spaced out and put on kiln cars where they move slowly through a kiln where they reach 1060 degrees C at their hottest. Then they are cooled, taken out and stacked ready for sale.
